value.title: Facial recognition software helps identify missing teen
value.excerpt: A 13-year-old autistic boy who went missing from Uttar Pradesh five years ago was traced at a child home in Assam with the help of facial recognition tool of Telangana police ‘Darpan’. He was reunited with his parents on Friday.

value.title: Buenos Aires is using facial recognition system that tracks child suspects, rights group says
value.excerpt: The country has made public the warrants of children wanted for alleged crimes, in violation of international law, according to Human Rights Watch.

value.title: Imposter ID'd With Facial Recognition Technology At Local Airport
value.excerpt: With the help of the Simplified Arrival process, customs officials detected a traveler's mismatched documents at Washington Dulles Airport.

value.title: Enhanced computer vision, sensors raise manufacturing stakes for robots as a service
value.excerpt: Firms developing computer vision technology for standard robots, developments in 3D vision and so-called “Robots as a Service” are defining the next wave of automation.

value.title: Exer Labs raises $2 million and launches computer vision app for Peloton-style coached workouts
value.excerpt: Exer Labs has raised $2 million in funding and it has unveiled its AI-based Exer Studio app for the Mac that captures your movements for coaching advice.

value.title: Facial recognition data leaks is rampant across China as Covid-19 pushes wider use of the technology
value.excerpt: Incorrectly configured databases remains a widespread security problem in China even as citizens increasingly express concerns.

value.title: Best facial recognition security cameras to buy in 2020
value.excerpt: Select home security cameras have facial recognition, an option that lets you make a profile of friends and family members who regularly come to your house. Then, when the camera sees a face, it determines whether or not it's someone in your list of known faces.

value.title: ExamSoft’s remote bar exam sparks privacy and facial recognition concerns

value.title: Madurai Police Launches Facial Recognition App To Reduce Crime Rate
value.excerpt: To reduce robberies and other crimes, the Madurai city police has introduced the FACETAGR app, a technology-enabled web-based processor, which matches the facial features of a suspect with the data stored in a database.

value.title: LAPD officers reportedly used facial recognition 30,000 times in the past decade, contradicting the department's previous denials
value.excerpt: Despite frequent denials and refusals to respond to public records requests, the LAPD has been using the controversial technology widely since 2009.

value.title: DHS Admits Facial Recognition Photos Were Hacked, Released on Dark Web
value.excerpt: Traveler’s faces, license plates, and care information were hacked from a subcontractor called Perceptics and released on the dark web.

value.title: In facial recognition challenge, top-ranking algorithms show bias against Black women
value.excerpt: The results from a recent facial recognition competition demonstrate that even the best algorithms are still prone to gender and racial bias.

value.title: Facebook Illinois Settlement: How to Get a Payout in $650 Million Facial Recognition Class Action
value.excerpt: When the tag feature is enabled, the social network uses face recognition technology to analyze photos and videos it believes a user is in and creates a template. The template is then used to recognize users as they appear in other photos or videos.
